Annotation.String: This type describes the settings of a resouce.
This type shall describe any attributes of a resouce.
Indicates the time the settings were applied.
The value of this property shall indicate the time that the settings object was applied to the resource.
The ETag of the resource to which the settings were applied, after the application.

The value of this property shall be the ETag of the resource to which the settings were applied, after the application. This is here so that the client can check it against the ETag of the current resource to see if any other changes have also happened to the resource.
Reference to the resource the client may PUT/PATCH to in order to change this resource.
The value of this property shall be the URI of the resource to which a client must do a PUT or PATCh in order to modify this resource.
This is an array of messages associated with the task.
The value of this property shall be an array of messages associated with the task.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.

This property indicates when a Settings resource can be applied.
A service shall advertise its applytime capabilities using this property as to when a Setting resource can be applied.
This object indicates when the future configuration (i.e. Settings resource) should be applied.
This object shall be specified by client in a request to indicate its preference on when to apply the values in this Settings resource.
This property indicates when the future configuration (i.e. Settings resource) should be applied.
The value of this property shall indicate the preference on to when to apply the values in this Settings resource.
The value of this property as specified by client to indicate the start time of a maintenance window.

The value of this property shall indicate the date and time as to when the service is allowed to start applying the future configuration as part of a maintenance window. This property shall be required if the ApplyTime property is specified as AtMaintenanceWindowStart or InMaintenanceWindowOnReset.
The value of this property as specified by client indicates the expiry time of maintenance window in seconds.

The value of this property shall indicate the end of the maintenance window as the number of seconds after the time specified by the MaintenanceWindowStartTime property. This property shall be required if the ApplyTime property is specified as AtMaintenanceWindowStart or InMaintenanceWindowOnReset.
Apply immediately.
This ApplyTime value shall be used to indicate the values within the Settings resource are applied immediately.
Apply on a reset.
This ApplyTime value shall be used to indicate the values within the Settings resource are applied when the system or service is reset.
Apply during a maintenance window as specified by an administrator.

This ApplyTime value shall be used to indicate the values within the Settings resource are applied during the maintenance window specified by the MaintenanceWindowStartTime and MaintenanceWindowDurationInSeconds properties. A service may perform resets during this maintenance window.
Apply after a reset but within maintenance window as specified by an adminstrator.

This ApplyTime value shall be used to indicate the values within the Settings resource are applied during the maintenance window specified by the MaintenanceWindowStartTime and MaintenanceWindowDurationInSeconds properties, and if a reset occurs within the maintenance window.
